reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Lanzarote for 2 weeks in January our first week here and second in Teguise Playa Costa Teguise (read reviews of it before you think about booking) We found the San Antonio and it's staff great from the moment we arrived. Yes it is a bit old fashioned and the rooms are a bit on the small side but they were spotlessly clean and well furnished and very comfortable. The food was great and always fresh and hot and the staff in the restaurant were lovely. The pool areas are also very clean and plenty of sun beds always available. The lounge and bar where the entertainment took place was very nice but the only thing we found was that the entertainment was mostly aimed at the over 50's, but we were close to other bars and would often take a taxi (about 2 or 3 euros) along the main strip to the many bars and clubs down there, so it wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Great hotel
very good would go back
reviews.text: All in all I would recommend the San Antonio but not for groups of young folk looking for clubs.

stayed at the san antonio hotel for two weeks in july.hotel was very clean rooms very small.also bewere at the pool side bar they try rip you off.games during the day very good [thank you jenny].food not that good very cold if you go in late [try room only] food is better eating out all and all good holiday will defo go back [room only though]
reviews.title: Don't listen to the moaners!

reviews.text: I don't usually write hotel reviews but after coming on here and seeing a handful of negative comments, I felt compelled to share my experience.
reviews.title: 4 star you are having a laugh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 1 week just before Christmas last year (2006) with my girlfriend and my mate and his girlfriend. Let me tell you, it is one of the nicest hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. I am fairly well travelled and have experienced many different hotels in many cities prior to staying here and how anyone can say anything negative about the San Antonio baffles me.
reviews.title: Lower end of 4 star!

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for and arrange for all the little things that are usually provided in a 4 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A quality hotel in a very convenient location. In a quieter area located between Puerto Del Carmen and Matagorda. A stroll will take you to Carmen and a longer stroll (about 25 mins.) to the old harbour. The hotel room was very large and very well appointed with Queen size bed and plenty of room, balcony was also spacious. Wardrobe (with hangers) and drawers more than ample. Food was buffet style and covered most European tastes with plenty of choice and good quality. They also had a seperate food theme each night. While we were there they offered Chinese, Japenese, Italian, Spanish and seafood nights. (No extra charge). The cabaret each night was very good and of a very high standard. You would not be disappointed. Pools were spacious and clean with plenty of free sunbeds. The hotel is very big, which I'm not used to, but it never felt crowded. Dinner whilst busy never felt like a "canteen". We had a really good holiday here and whilst slightly more expensive it gave true value for money. Very impressed.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel
Friendly hotel
reviews.text: We have just spent a week at this great hotel and wished we could have stayed longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is well situated on the edge of the town and on the beach.
reviews.title: Food could be hotter !!!!!

likes.disliked: — The food, needs a new restaurant manager

reviews.title: average
reviews.text: We had a seaview room which was worth paying the extra for.

reviews.title: Take a break
reviews.text: The food was good and plentiful, with plenty of choice.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This was the third time to stay at the San Antonio. The location is superb as we love the beach and the pool and also the distance from the main town and matagorda. Reception was a bit frosty - we could not get the full sea view we booked and gave up eventually. Waiting staff and cleaning staff were very friendly. The variety of food was down on previous visits. Some items like scrambled egg were cold but we located a microwave which helped!!! Would I go back? Having studied all the other hotels around its hard to beat the location of the San Antonio. The bus stop and taxi rank are outside. Entertainment is good at night. . The food is OK - and you can go out a few nights to other restauants so yes I will go back.

Just returned from a very enjoyable stay at San Antonio Hotel. This hotel is situated on the beach, has two lovely swimming pools, children's pool and plenty of space for sun worshipers. There is excellent entertainment every night with different entertainers and dancing. Most of the holidaymakers were in the 50+ age group but this is probably because of the time of the year as the non-retired would be working. I would recommend this hotel to couples wanting a relaxing and romantic holiday. The hotel is situated just a nice stroll from the centre of Peurto del Carmen (2 mins from shops, bars and restuarants). Bus stop just outside the door to Arricife or Puerto del Carmen (1 euro). Taxi rank outside door (4 euro to old town Puerto del Carmen). Hotel stylish, spotless clean, good variety of food at buffet, staff very friendly (with exception one lady at reception, beware!) Entertainment manager great. When one considers that we paid 39 euro per person per day for half board, it is great value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Great Value

likes.disliked: — No proper triple rooms available. Buffet evening meal, prefer being served.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel San Antonio from 19th to 26th Jan 08. There were two of us traveling under the age of 37. We were located in a hotel suit, which is classed as the best room in the hotel. To be honest my feelings are mixed. I have stayed in many 4 star hotels and this is definitely not a 4 star. It would maybe be a mid-3-star.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings on this hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is not at all luxurious, it is basic and simple but has a lot going for it also – some good and bad points below:
